Docs.remarks: This constructor exists only to support mocking. When used, class state is not fully initialized, and will not function correctly; virtual members are meant to be mocked.

Docs.param: The to abandon.
The properties of the message to modify while abandoning the message.
An optional instance to signal the request to cancel the operation.
Docs.summary: Abandons a .This will make the message available again for immediate processing as the lock on the message held by the receiver will be released.
Docs.returns: A task to be resolved on when the operation has completed.
Docs.remarks: Abandoning a message will increase the delivery count on the message. This operation can only be performed on messages that were received by this receiver when is set to .

item.description: The lock for the message has expired or the message has already been completed. This does not apply for session-enabled entities. The will be set to in this case.

Docs.param: The to defer.
The properties of the message to modify while deferring the message.
An optional instance to signal the request to cancel the operation.
Docs.summary: Indicates that the receiver wants to defer the processing for the message.
Docs.returns: A task to be resolved on when the operation has completed.
Docs.remarks:
In order to receive this message again in the future, you will need to save the
and receive it using . Deferring messages does not impact message's expiration, meaning that deferred messages can still expire. This operation can only be performed on messages that were received by this receiver.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Threading.Tasks.Task RenewMessageLockAsync (Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusReceivedMessage message, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken = default);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task RenewMessageLockAsync(class Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusReceivedMessage message, valuetype System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken) cil managed
Public Overridable Function RenewMessageLockAsync (message As ServiceBusReceivedMessage, Optional cancellationToken As CancellationToken = Nothing) As Task

abstract member RenewMessageLockAsync : Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusReceivedMessage * System.Threading.CancellationToken -> System.Threading.Tasks.Task override this.RenewMessageLockAsync : Azure.Messaging.ServiceBus.ServiceBusReceivedMessage * System.Threading.CancellationToken -> System.Threading.Tasks.Task

Docs.param: The to renew the lock for.
An optional instance to signal the request to cancel the operation.
Docs.summary: Renews the lock on the message. The lock will be renewed based on the setting specified on the queue.
Docs.remarks: When a message is received in mode, the message is locked on the server for this receiver instance for a duration as specified during the Queue/Subscription creation (LockDuration). If processing of the message requires longer than this duration, the lock needs to be renewed. For each renewal, it resets the time the message is locked by the LockDuration set on the Entity.
Docs.exception: The lock for the message has expired or the message has already been completed. The will be set to in this case.
